page.title: 20Elvering
page.content: Across the Atlatic Ocean in the Gulf of Mexico eels lay their eggs in the Sargasso Sea. When the elvers hatch they cross the ocean and swim up the Bristol Channel. Some find their way into the river Parrett.They arrive in the Spring and elvering begins. They are only caught at certain times as the river is tidal.The really keen people will go out in the middle of the night to catch elvers.Large hand nets are used. Although some of the elvers are eaten by local people, most are sold for export to the continent where they are turned into smoked or jellied eels. The elvering season is very short, but some people make very useful pocket money from their efforts. Small boys look forward to the day when they are old enough to go elvering with their fathers.
